page.title: 03HOUSING IN EASSIE
page.content: We looked at the houses in our area and we found that they were all built of sandstone, apart from the council houses, which were built of brick and harling. We noticed that the seven farmhouses were very large indeed and had mostly been built towards the end of the 19th. century or at the beginning of this century. There were 32 farm cottages belonging to the farms, many of which are now let as holiday homes. We have a total of 14 council houses, none of whose tenants are connected with farming. The rest of the houses in the area are privately owned.
